forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds with a delicate interplay of sun and clouds, suggesting that the day remains refreshingly brisk yet tinged with the possibility of a light shower. As the mercury climbs, expect a pleasant high around 60, though a gradual dip to about 56 whispers of the typical maritime influence. The west winds weave through the streets, carrying a gentle breeze, while the chance of rain flirts at 30%, hinting at only a drizzle to grace the pavement, most likely before dawn.

As daylight succumbs to twilight, the atmosphere will shift to a partly cloudy canvas, the temperature retreating to a cool 48. A similar wind dance continues, with gusts stirring enough to remind you of the Bay’s unpredictable nature. It’s likely you will find yourself enveloped in a serene blend of coastal air, accompanied by a chance of brief rain. Given these conditions, a well-layered outfit—a comfortable sweater or jacket—would suffice as you explore the city. Perhaps a casual stroll through one of the many charming neighborhoods, or a visit to a local café to watch the world pass by, would be the perfect way to absorb the day's quiet complexity and anticipation for the evening ahead.
